cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 miles southwest of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the southeast and central Gulf of Mexico and aiming for the northern Gulf Coast (Louisiana/Mississippi) late Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast between Intracoastal City and the Mouth of the Pearl River (near the New Orleans area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from the Mississippi/Alabama border to the Alabama/Florida border (far west of the port)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Intracoastal City, LA to Mouth of the Pearl River; Storm Surge Warning east of Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA to the MS/AL border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana to coastal Mississippi and Alabama; Florida west-central coast (including Manatee County) only peripheral impacts
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤5%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusty showers possible late Saturday through Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge flooding expected along the Manatee County coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could drop 1–3 inches of rain Saturday night–Sunday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased rip currents and rough surf along west-central Florida beaches
